fields.description:
h3. Summary 
Currently this repo appears to be deploying Confluence with the incorrect collation set to C instead of UTF-8

This issue seems to affect all files calling {{atl_createRemoteDb}}:

atlassian-aws-deployment//ami/scripts/init.d/atl-init-confluence.sh
atlassian-aws-deployment//ami/scripts/init.d/atl-init-jira.sh:
atlassian-aws-deployment//ami/scripts/init.d/atl-init-crowd.sh:
Example: {code} atl_createRemoteDb "${ATL_CONFLUENCE_SHORT_DISPLAY_NAME}" "${ATL_DB_NAME}" "${ATL_JDBC_USER}" "${ATL_DB_HOST}" "${ATL_DB_PORT}" "C" "C" "template0 {code}

This appears to be setting Confluence Collation to C instead of UTF-8. According to our Postgres Docs for Confluence [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/database-setup-for-postgresql-173244522.html], C is known to cause issues with Confluence and is not a supported config.

h3. Environment 
* Confluence Server

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Deploy to AWS with our Cloud Formation Templates templates
h3. Expected Results 
Confluence will be deployed correctly

h3. Actual Results 
The user will receive WARN on start up that the database isn't configured correctly:

{code} 2019-03-18 16:52:34,434 WARN [localhost-startStop-1] [confluence.impl.health.DefaultHealthCheckRunner] logEvent The database collation 'C' is not supported by Confluence. You need to use 'utf-8'. {code}

h3. Workaround
N/A - User will have to recreate DB with correct settings or have a DBA fix the collation issue on the existing db
fields.summary: Confluence Data Center CloudFormation deployment postgres collation incorrect

fields.description:
h3. Issue summary
 # Editing a repeated event, and adding a user into it causes the event to duplicate itself on that day.

h3. Tested on
 # Confluence 6.15.2 and 6.15.4
 # Team Calendar 6.0.27 and 6.0.32

h3. Steps to replicate
 # Create a weekly repeated event, from Monday to Friday for example, with a single user.
 # Now for the created events, edit any one of it, add another user in into the "Who" section.
 # Save the event, and there will be two events on that day.
 ** One will be the older event before the second user was added.
 ** And the other will be with the new user added as well.

h3. Current behavior
 # Adding a user into a repeated event causes duplicate entry.

(!) Note: it has also been observed during multiple edits of existing events, that other events are removed from the Calendar.

h3. Expected behavior
 # Adding a user into a repeated event should not cause a duplicate entry, and the existing event should be updated accordingly.

h3. Workaround
 # Delete the older event after.
fields.summary: Adding a user to a repeated event causes duplicate event to be created

2019-05-28 10:27:57,491 WARN [http-nio-26154-exec-8] [confluence.extra.flyingpdf.ConfluenceExportUserAgent] getImageResource Could not retrieve image resource https://images.pexels.com/photos/2313397/pexels-photo-2313397.jpeg?auto=compress&cs=tinysrgb&dpr=2&h=750&w=1260 during Confluence export

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
By default, in the managed Synchrony deployment (both for Server and Data Center), the default Synchrony heap is 1GB.
This is not enough for most of the deployments and it may often cause OOM problems on the Synchrony JVM.

On Confluence Data Center prior to the managed Synchrony, the startup script had the heap configured to 2GB by default.
Migrating to managed from the standalone cluster may create a problem if the default configuration is used.

h3. Suggested Solution
Ship Confluence (Server and Data Center) with a default Synchrony JVM heap size to at least 2GB by using the following JVM attribute:
{code}
-Dsynchrony.memory.max=2g
{code}

Also, please consider if a higher value (such as 4GB) should be used as the default heap size on Data Center.

h3. Workaround 
Manually configure the {{-Dsynchrony.memory.max=2g}} in each Confluence node.
See [How to Increase Synchrony Heap Allocation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-increase-synchrony-heap-allocation-936516650.html] and [Add or remove Confluence system properties|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/startup-check-add-or-remove-confluence-system-properties-938861976.html] for further information.
fields.summary: Increase managed Synchrony JVM maximum memory to at least 2GB

h3. Summary  

* Line breaks are not working when you add a *Code Block macro* or a *Panel macro* inside a bullet list.

h3. Environment 
* Google Chrome
* Safari

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
# On the editor of a Confluence page, create a bullet list and a few items, for example:
{code}
1. Some text
2. Some text
3. Some text {Code Block}
{code}
# After inserting the *Code Block macro*, place the cursor on the editor, in the end of the block, and hit *ENTER*

h3. Expected Results  

* A new line is created below the *Code Block macro*, looking like:
{code}
1. Some text
2. Some text
3. Some text 
{Code Block}
4. Some text
{code}

h3. Actual Results 

* A new line is created above the *Code Block macro*, looking like:

{Code Block}
{code}

fields.description:
There is an element that Confluence uses called {{aui-spinner}} that governs a loading animated icon when typing in Global Quick search. However, it appears that the positioning is off by about 5-10px.

h3. Expected Behavior
- aui-spinner element replaces the Quick Search magnifying glass icon when searching for elements to auto-suggest

h3. Actual Behavior
- aui-spinner shows up to one side of the Quick Search bar - see screenshot for an example.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes from Support

- Confluence overrides some parameters from AUI elements that influence the positioning of certain items in the default UI.
- There is no way to fix this manually as it comes from computed CSS in the archives. This would reflect a product-level fix for the positioning of the aui-spinner element.
- This worked fine in Confluence 6.6. This looks like it might have been due to UI elements refreshed that were introduced after that version branch.
- In the default color scheme it is not very noticeable unless you know what to look for. However, it can cause some confusion with the look and feel elements and is reproducible.
- Originally we were able to only reproduce this with Firefox (macOS latest stable path). We were able to reproduce this later with Chrome (macOS latest developer build), so there may be something with the browser rendering of this element that causes this discrepancy.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: aui-spinner element is offset from Global Quick Search elements

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Some Team Calendars operations are resource expensive and can interfere on other regular Confluence tasks.
This can lead to users experiencing overall slow downs on Confluence, which could be caused by punctual tasks.

h3. Suggested Solution
With the introduction of the [sandbox framework|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-discussions/Sandbox-Framework-for-Confluence-Server/td-p/1076306] we have now a way to move expensive processes to a separated JVM so that they don't interfere directly on Confluence performance.
For example, if a calendar export requires too much of the heap, it won't need to conflict with other regular Confluence operations for resources.

This suggestion is opened so that we can start to design Team Calendars on a way it can take advantage of the sandbox framework in any expensive task, making Confluence and TC more reliable and stable.
 
h3. Workaround 
_None so far_
fields.summary: Move Team Calendars expensive tasks to the Sandbox Framework

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When an app vendor did some load tests on their end, they encounter lots of {{ConcurrentModificationException}} exceptions
h3. Environment
Total Spaces	5019
Site Spaces	5019
Personal Spaces	0
Content (All Versions)	4068499
Content (Current Versions)	3966151
Local Users	10524
Local Groups	1008

Java VM Memory Statistics
Heap Memory	
Used Memory (61 %)	 Free Memory (39 %)
39 % Free
Maximum Heap Size	12288 MB
Total Allocated Memory	12288 MB
Used Memory	7517 MB
Free Allocated Memory	4770 MB
Total Free Memory	4770 MB

h3. Expected Results
No or less hazelcast exceptions

h3. Actual Results
Lots of hazelcast exxceptions

The below exception is thrown in the log file:
 [^atlassian-confluence.log.zip] 

h3. Notes
The root cause is these two methods:
{{com.atlassian.confluence.extra.userlister.DefaultUserListManager#registerLoggedInUser}}
{{com.atlassian.confluence.extra.userlister.DefaultUserListManager#unregisterLoggedInUser}}

When the system is under the stress test, these two methods are called frequently and concurrently. Both of them call {{com.atlassian.confluence.extra.userlister.DefaultUserListManager#cacheLoggedInUser}}, which retrieves the HashMap of user's sessions from the cache and modifies it. Once there are more than one threads that attempt to modify the HashMap, while Hazelcast is iterating over it (in order to serialise the HashMap), then we have the {{java.util.ConcurrentModificationException.}}

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Confluence Datacenter instances throwing tons of Hazelcast exceptions : ConcurrentModificationException

fields.description:
*Issue Description*

When Service Desk is integrated with Confluence 6.15.4, the following issue happens: when a customer clicks on a KB article from the Service Desk Customer Portal, they get the following error:
{code}The knowledge base article could not be found
{code}
 !Step1.png|thumbnail! 
 !Step2.png|thumbnail! 

Note that when the Customer clicks on the same KB article from the issue creation form, the page loads properly:
 !Step3.png|thumbnail! 
 !Step4.png|thumbnail! 

*Steps to Reproduce*

- Install any Service Desk version such as 3.15.x, 3.16.x, 4.1.0
- Install Confluence 6.15.4
- Create an application link between Confluence and Service Desk using Oauth with impersonation
- Configure an external user directory in Confluence using the JIRA directory to ensure that the JIRA users exist in Confluence
- Create a space in Confluence
- Create an article in this space (with "laptop" as a title)
- Create a new Service Desk project, and configure the Knowledge Base setting as follows:
-- Use the space created in Confluence
-- Select the option "All active users and customers can access the knowledge base without a Confluence license"
- Log into the Service Desk customer portal with a user *which does not have a Confluence license*
- Search for the KB article by typing "laptop" in the search box
- Click on the KB article

*Observed*

- The KB article loads forever (we get a spinning wheel)
- If we refresh the page, we get the following error in the UI:
{code}The knowledge base article could not be found
{code}
 !Step2.png|thumbnail! 
- If we collect a HAR file, we get a a 404 error with the request "/rest/servicedesk/1/customer/models"
- The following error is thrown in the logs:
{code}
2019-06-06 14:48:54,958 http-nio-8080-exec-7 ERROR customer1 888x235x1 oqwnl5 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /servicedesk/customer/kb/view/884742 [c.a.s.i.api.applink.BaseAppLinkResponseHandler] Applink request has returned an error %s
2019-06-06 14:48:54,958 http-nio-8080-exec-7 ERROR customer1 888x235x1 oqwnl5 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /servicedesk/customer/kb/view/884742 [c.a.s.i.api.applink.BaseAppLinkResponseHandler] Confluence could not find the requested page and returned a 404
{code}

*Additional notes*

- The issue occurs whether the Confluence application is configured with anonymous access or not
- The issue *does not happen* in the 2 following scenarios:
-- The user has a Confluence license: in this case, this user can open the KB article from *both the Customer Portal homepage, and from the request creation form*
-- The user does not have a Confluence license and *opens the KB article from the request creation form*
fields.summary: When Service Desk is integrated with Confluence 6.15.4, knowledge base articles can't be open from the Customer Portal (error 404)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When exporting a page with a few tabs on Confluence 6.13.0 or later, it only exports the first tab. 

h3. Environment
Confluence 6.13.0 or later with the confluence-flyingpdf-plugin version 6.1.2 and later.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install the plugin [Navitabs|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/28632/navitabs-tabs-for-confluence?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] on Confluence 6.13.0
# Create a new page with 2 tabs.
# Save the page and export the page to PDF

h3. Expected Results
All tabs should be exported within the same page. 

h3. Actual Results
Only the first tab has been exported to the page. 

h3. Notes
We've tested the same all old version works correctly until the plugin version 6.1.2 shipped with Confluence 6.13.0 and later.

h3. Workaround
# Replace the plugin file "[confluence-flyingpdf-plugin-6.0.10.jar|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/356619/confluence-flyingpdf-plugin-6.0.10.jar]" in the folder "<Confluence instance>/confluence/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins/"
# Shutdown Confuence and perform a plugin cache clear procedure. 
# Restart Confluence.
fields.summary: PDF export do not work correctly any more with the tabs on the page

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When a Jira issue macro is inserted into a page, Confluence will attempt to contact that Jira instance and link the page to the issue. If for some reason the link attempt fails, then Confluence will not link the issue to the page, and the number of issue links will be invalid.

h3.Example
A customer may use something like ScriptRunner to create Jira issues in a Post Function, and then link them to a Confluence page. In cases where Jira hasn't finished reindexing an issue, Jira will return a 404 not found error for that issue, and the remoteLink will not be created.

h3. Suggested Solution
Confluence should check if the number of Jira links on the page matches the number returned by Jira's {{remote-link-aggregation}} endpoint (which is how Confluence determines the number of links on the page). If there is a mismatch, Confluence should attempt to recreate the links (although it would have to be done carefully to avoid inadvertently overwhelming Jira).
 
h3. Workaround
In cases involving automation, it's possible to manually create the missing remote links, either by a REST or Java API.

For normal cases where Confluence could not reach Jira at the time of saving the page, try removing the Jira issue macro, saving the page, and then re-adding the macro again.
fields.summary: The "Jira Links" section should be more proactive in creating RemoteLinks based on Jira issue macros in the page.

fields.description:

At the very least, when hitting viewnotifcations.acton adding a hidden query parameter like "limit=X" would be more helpful so you can see more entries per page.
fields.summary: Add bulk option to stop watching pages

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition  

* Currently, there isn't an option to customize through the UI what content should be shown in the PDF export. For example, there could be an option to hide the page's title in the PDF export.

h3. Suggested Solution  

* Add options to customize the PDF export through the UI.

h3. Why this is important   

* There are a few customizations that, when done through the PDF stylesheets, cause issues on the page. For example, trying to hide the page title eventually causes other *h1* occurrences to be hidden as well.

h3. Workaround 
N/A
fields.summary: Add the ability to customize PDF Export through the UI

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
After adding a panel macro to a page, we found that the macro has no default border until we specify in the setting.
!Screen Shot 2019-06-04 at 11.04.20.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Add the panel macro on a new page with some text and save the page. 

h3. Expected Results
The panel should be added with a default border. 

h3. Actual Results
There isn't any border for the panel macro. 

h3. Workaround
You can add the following CSS script in the CSS stylesheet: 
{code}
.wiki-content .panel
{border-color:#dfe1e5;  }
{code}
which will bring the border after the saving the page but it will not show on the preview mode.
fields.summary: Panel macro has not border by default

fields.description:
In server.xml, there are a few sample connectors that are commented out. All except one sets 48 for maxThreads. The sample connector for unproxied HTTPS access sets a value of 150, which is a relic from older versions and is no longer the recommended value:

{code}
<!--
         ==============================================================================================================
         HTTPS - Direct connector with no proxy, for unproxied HTTPS access to Confluence.

         For more info see https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/s3UC
         ==============================================================================================================
        -->

        <!--
        <Connector port="8443" maxHttpHeaderSize="8192"
                   maxThreads="150" minSpareThreads="25"
                   protocol="org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Nio2Protocol"
                   enableLookups="false" disableUploadTimeout="true"
                   acceptCount="100" scheme="https" secure="true"
                   clientAuth="false" sslProtocol="TLSv1.2" sslEnabledProtocols="TLSv1.2" SSLEnabled="true"
                   URIEncoding="UTF-8" keystorePass="<MY_CERTIFICATE_PASSWORD>"/>
        -->
{code}

I suggest changing that to 48 to be in line with our current recommendations for maxThreads vs. C3P0 connections.
fields.summary: Change maxThreads for unproxied connector example

fields.description:
h3. Summary  

In a page that has an *Expand macro*, if you hit backspace when the cursor is in its line, after you come back to edit the page again you won't be able to see the macro's title

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
# Edit a page that has an *Expand macro*
# Place the cursor right before the macro
# Hit the backspace
# Click to close the page and select *Keep Draft*
# Edit the page again

h3. Expected Results 

* The macro's title will still show up 

h3. Actual Results 

* The titles and names are are not displayed

h3. Notes 
* Before you hit the backspace, the *background-image property* shows up normally
 !Picture1.png|thumbnail! 
* After hitting the backspace, it shows in double-quotes
 !Picture2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround 
* Discard all changes
* Publish the page
fields.summary: Expand Macro title not showing up after making changes in the editor

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 29 July 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5|titleBGColor=#3C78B5|titleColor=#FFFFFF|bgColor=#E7F4FA}
After some analysis we've found that this issue has been duplicated by the issue at [CONFSERVER-57949 - Changing the color of links in Confluence pages does not reflect on the links once the page is published| https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-57949]. This is a current and verified bug in Confluence, please watch that issue for further updates and more detailed workarounds.
{panel}

h3. Issue Summary
When saving a page, Confluence removes text coloring on links to Confluence pages.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open the editor
# Insert a link to another page
# Highlight the link
# In the text color picker in the editor toolbar, change the color of the link
# Click *Update* to save the page

h3. Expected Results
The page is saved with the link colored as it was in the editor.

h3. Actual Results
The published page shows the link as the default link color. Re-opening the editor also shows the text as default link color.

h3. Notes
* Can reproduce in Confluence 6.15.4, but not in 6.8.0
* Does not affect links to external URLs

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When saving a page, Confluence removes text coloring on links to Confluence pages.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When performing migrating from one Confluence instance to another using XML backup and where the source Confluence is running MySQL and the destination Confluence is running Oracle database, attachments that includes apostrophe will not render in the destination Confluence and instead an "Unknown Attachment" will be displayed in pages where the attachment should be displayed. 

The issue seems to only happen on pages, as these attachments can be seen, previewed and download through the *Attachments List* page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup a Confluence instance that is using MySQL
# Include Attachments with titles that include apostrophe for example {{Capture d'écran.png}}
# Add these attachments into Confluence pages, via drag and drop or through *Insert files and Images*
# Perform a site XML backup. 
# Setup a Confluence instance that is using Oracle
# Restore site backup from the first Confluence backup. 
# Head over to the pages where the above attachments is suppose to be displayed


h3. Expected Results
The attachments will be shown I these pages. 

h3. Actual Results
The areas of the page were the attachment is added is now displaying {{Unknown Attachment}} error. 

h3. Notes
As the issue seems to only occur in pages but not in the Attachment List, it seems that it is caused by « ' » in image name were wrongly replaced with HTML escape . The escape sequence for apostrophes with Oracle is a double apostrophe. 

h3. Workaround
Manually replace single apostrophes in the BodyContent table with double apostrophe
fields.summary: Attachments that includes apostrophe will be shown as Unknown Attachment after migrating from MySQL to Oracle using XML backup
Jira's custom date field doesn't appear when creating TC event if the custom field context is restricted to a specific issue type

fields.description:
Currently, the "Jira Issue Macro" has to mode :
 * Single Issue
 * Filter Issue

Only the 'Single Issue' generates a 'mentioned in' link in the concerned Issue.

In 'Filter Issue' mode, no link is generated. It is comprehensible since the returned issues can change depending on the date or the remote user.

Since 'Single Issue' is considered like the filter "key = UDDTC-411", a possible improvement could be to allow the "Mentioned in" link event for simple Issue Filter, with only key or issueKey as criteria with operators "=" and "in".

Also a filter issueKey in (FOO-100, FOO-101) will generate the ''Mentioned in" link in both Issue.

 

Vincent
fields.summary: Imporve "Jira Issue Macro" with 'mentioned in' link

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition  

* Confluence 6.5 showed the space icons, under the *My Spaces* section in the left sidebar, as circular shapes. In Confluence 6.15, these same icons are now showing up in square shapes. This change affected customer who had the icons designed to fit circular shapes.

h3. Suggested Solution

* Provide an option that allows users to select in which shape they would like to display the space icons.

h3. Why this is important   

* In Confluence instances that have many spaces, changing their icons to match the now square shapes can be quite demanding since this isn't something possible to perform in bulk.

h3. Workaround 

* N/A
fields.summary: Possibility to change space icons' shape

fields.description:
h3. Step to Replicate
# Ensure that you have a running Confluence 6.15.2 instance with PostgreSQL database using 'C' as the collation.
# Create a page with title *Центр Консалтинга*
# Create another page with title *Серверная инфраструктур*
# Include the furst page *Центр Консалтинга* into the second page *Серверная инфраструктур* using the *Include Page* macro.
# Generate the XML site backup for this Confluence instance.
# Setup Confluence 6.15.2 instance with PostgreSQL database using 'UTF-8' or any other as the collation.
# Import the XML site backup into the new instance.
# Check out the second page *Серверная инфраструктур*.

h3. Environment
Confluence 6.15.2
PostgreSQL Database

h3. Expected Results
The *Include Page* macro in the second page *Серверная инфраструктур* works correctly.

h3. Actual Results
*Unable to render {include}* appear in the second page *Серверная инфраструктур*

h3. Notes
Customer who perform the steps in *Method 1* from [How to fix the collation of a Postgres Confluence database|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-fix-the-collation-of-a-postgres-confluence-database-966676071.html] to fix the database collation will be affected by this bug.

h3. Workaround
Updating the page title for the page to include resolve the issue. For example, update the title *Центр Консалтинга* to *Центр* and back to *Центр Консалтинга*.
*OR*
To simply add an arbitrary update to the affected page to create a new version of the page.
fields.summary: Changing the PostgreSQL database collation break the Include Macro if the Page Title to include contain Russian Alphabet

fields.description: Provide support for Support for Oracle Database 19c in Confluence Server/ DC.
fields.summary: Support for Oracle 19c

fields.description:
h5. Problem Definition
Currently, Confluence has no visual way to tell users the application is performing an upgrade. The only way to know that is through the application logs, which may not be very friendly to users and admins.


h5. Suggested Solution
When Confluence is performing an upgrade, there should be a specific page showing a progress bar or at least telling the user that an upgrade is in progress and for further details we should check the application logs.
fields.summary: Upgrade Progress Page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 # When an indented list is copied and pasted into a Word file, the indent is brought over, depending on which browser it's copied from.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an ordered or unordered list in Confluence, with some indented items in the list.
 # Save the page, and copy and paste the text into a word file like Microsoft Word, or Libre Writter.
 ## In Chrome: The indent disappears, and the whole list appears as a single list.
 ## In Firefox: The indent appears fine.
 ## In IE: The first few items on the list appear in the first point.

h3. Expected Results
 # All items in the list appear as they were when viewed in Confluence, when pasted into a Word processor.

h3. Workaround
 # In Chrome, if we copy the list when editing the page, the list appears fine on Libre Writer, but not in Microsoft Word.
fields.summary: Confluence list indent not respected when copied and pasted from different browsers

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Searching for spaces with {{space.title}} field using contains operator (~) also matches with the creator's username. It returns spaces even if the space title does not match with the given input but the input matches a creator name.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Search for spaces with a {{space.title}} that contains texts that also matches a space creator's name like {{/rest/api/search?cql=type=space%20and%20space.title~%22testuser*%22}}

h3. Expected Results
It should only return spaces if the given input matches the space title or part of it

h3. Actual Results
The above call returns spaces even though there is no space title that contains the word "testuser" but was created by user "testuser" or "testuser1" etc...

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Using search.title and space fields in CQL also matches with the space creator

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Moving a page tree with title conflicts between spaces in Confluence Server results in vague $error

h3. Steps to Reproduce
move a page tree (parent and its children) from a regular space to a personal space (that isn't my own).


h3. Expected Results
The error message should state that there are specific page title conflicts similar to...
 !error2.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Actual Results
vague $error message. `$error` messages show when moving the parent page and there are title conflicts, but the error message shown does not say that directly
 !error1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

There are two ways of getting the list of pages that already exist with the same title on the destination space:

# Use the Copy Page Hierarchy instead of Move page,
# Or, get a [HAR file|https://confluence.atlassian.com/kb/generating-har-files-and-analyzing-web-requests-720420612.html] while hitting the Move button and inspect the *movepage.action* request, the Response Content will contain the list of duplicate page titles
fields.summary: Moving a page tree with title conflicts between spaces in Confluence Server results in vague $error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the Periodic Scan function in Troubleshooting and Support Tools > Log Scanner, the results e-mail sent at the designated time has an incorrect number.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Troubleshooting and Support Tools
# Click on the Log Scanner tab
# Run a normal scan and take note of the amount of results.
# Choose Periodic Scan and specify the start time, frequency and recipients to send the scan results to. 
# Check email, and then check the total.  This is inconsistent with the actual amount of issues listed in the email, as well as the regular scanner.  

h3. Expected Results
The number is accurate and reflects the amount of issues displayed.

h3. Actual Results
The number is inaccurate in the e-mail.  In two tests, a scan with 4 results said 5, and a scan with 11 results (pictured) says "Found 13 known problems in the log file...".

 !Screen Shot 2019-05-29 at 10.44.19.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Incorrect number of Known Issues in Log Scanner Results Email

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

Accessing iCAL subscription link generated by TeamCal causes response 500 from the server. The contents of the response is JSON containing one string element: "java.lang.NullPointerException".

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Minification definition from [Wikipedia|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Minification_(programming)]:
{quote}
Minification (also minimisation or minimization), is the process of removing all unnecessary characters from the source codes of interpreted programming languages or markup languages without changing their functionality. These unnecessary characters usually include white space characters, new line characters, comments, and sometimes block delimiters, which are used to add readability to the code but are not required for it to execute. Minification reduces the size of the source code, making its transmission over a network (e.g. the Internet) more efficient.
{quote}

Team Calendars (TC) does not minify its JavaScript (JS) files.
Checking a Batch JS file transferred when displaying a sample page, uncompressed Team Calendars JS content has a size of almost 2MB.
Using public available JS minification services, the size of the file was cut in half.

Since this occurs on page view, which encompasses the majority of Confluence usage, transferring optimised JS files can lead to faster page loading times, specially on large instances.

h3. Suggested Solution
Ship Team Calendars {{.obr}} with minified version of JS and CSS files.

h3. Workaround 
_No workaround available so far._
fields.summary: Release Team Calendars with minified versions of JS and CSS files

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When clicking on Edit with for an attachment on the page, Companion app locks the browser window. If someone needs to edit another attachment on the same page, the user has to open a new browser tab for the same page

h3. Suggested Solution
* After clicking on Edit With, a browser window shouldn't be locked with upload option.
* Upload of the document should happen automatically once the user has saved and closed the document.
h3. Workaround 
(Optional)
* Open multiple browser windows/tabs to edit multiple attachments
fields.summary: Allow Atlassian companion app to edit multiple attachments on a page without opening multiple tabs in browser

fields.description:
h3. Current Behaviour
When a page is deleted, it is added to a space level recycle bin.

Over time, deleted pages accumulate here prior to being deleted with a delete all function (basically empty recycle bin).

There is no way to preview content held within the recycle bin.

h2. Suggested Behaviour
Add a function to allow pages to be previewed prior to being deleted from the recycle bin.

This would allow users to check the content about to be deleted, should be deleted.
fields.summary: Add a preview feature to the recycle bin

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Table column width doesn't appear to match with the actual Confluence page after exporting to PDF.

We could also see the same behaviour in cases that we applied the workaround suggested in [CONFSERVER-54275|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-54275].
{code:java|title=PDF Stylesheet}
table.fixedTableLayout {
table-layout: auto !important;
width: auto !important;
}
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page
# Create a 2X2 table
# Paste a long string into one of the columns and short strings into the others
# Re-adjust the column to have fixed width
# Save the Page
# Export to PDF

h3. Expected Results

Each column width should be based on the contents.

h3. Actual Results

Each column width is not matching the content.

 !Screen Shot 2019-05-24 at 6.58.13 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Note

This only affects tables set as _Fixed_.
h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Table width is not identical as the content when exported to PDF

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using IE11 and scrolling with tables wider than the section causes the tables to flicker & jump between the right hand side and back to the left.

h3. Environment
* Windows 10 17134
* IE11


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a table to a section and fill it with data so it is wider than the section and long enought to require vertical scrolling
 # Scroll vertically
 # Notice the table flickers/jumps left & right over and over

h3. Expected Results
Table scrolls without any jumping around of horizontal position

h3. Actual Results
Table jumps to the far right and back, appearing like a flicker almost.

h3. Notes
Attached screen recording shows the behaviour

h3. Workaround

I did notice a _minor_ improvement by disabling smooth scrolling in IE11 advanced settings. But it did still occur.
fields.summary: Scrolling in IE11 with a table wider than a section causes the table to flicker left & right

fields.description:
h4. Problem Statement
The 'New expanded search' result is not prioritizing the *Page title* as it used to in previous 'Quick Search'.

h4. How 'Old Quick Search' gives results:
This search gives a result based on the following:
* title + boosting by recency + space preference

h4. How 'New Expanded Search' gives results:
This search gives a result based on the following:
* title (less sophisticated) + content body (number of matches of the word in the content) + boosting by recency

h4. Improvement
* Page title should still be the priority instead of less sophisticated, followed by the content body matches and recency.
fields.summary: New Expanded Search result order should consider 'Page title' with highest priority

fields.description:
h6. PROBLEM STATEMENT
Confluence allows users to set the search filter while searching the content in specific spaces or pages. However, users may not want to include their personal pages/spaces in the search.

h6. SUGGESTION
It would be great if a custom search filter as a 'Don't include personal pages/spaces' is added to Confluence search.

h6. SUGGESTED WORKAROUND 
* Adding labels to personal pages
* Search it by using the 'NOT' syntax as below:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Improve the Search Result filter to remove all personal pages/spaces from the search

fields.description:
Hi Team,

We have a query regarding Share a link option in confluence.

Currently we are using confluence 6.15.1
According to the upgrade notes of 6.15.1, [https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/confluence-6-15-upgrade-notes-965554124.html]
------------------------
Upgrade notes

Changes to the Share a link blueprint

URLs must be added to Confluence's whitelist before they can be shared using the Share a link blueprint. This is to prevent people from accidentally or maliciously sharing links that may pose a security risk to your site. 
------------------------
{color:#FF0000}As a solution we can disable whitelist but it is recommend not disabling the whitelist by atlassian.{color}

Reason for not disabling: 
We have the html-include-macro enabled in our confluence due to the need to include data from other sites in our confluence site. When enabling html-include macro we had to enable whitelistning as it open up for cross-site scripting.

So my question is :
Did Shared link functionality has same risk of cross site scripting as html include macro ?
If your answer is NO, can you separate whitelist for Shared link?
fields.summary: can you separate whitelist for Shared link in confluence?

fields.description:
The current "Delete Space" interface makes it far too easy to accidentally (and permanently) erase massive amounts of data, with one mouse-click

 

!image-2019-05-23-13-54-13-609.png!

 

Instead of this very-error prone UI, can a manual confirmation step be used, similar to how Github works:

 

!image-2019-05-23-13-56-44-397.png!
fields.summary: Add a manual "type to confirm" step when deleting a space

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Depending on the number of watchers in a page (space watchers as well), creating or deleting page comments can take several seconds.
This happens because Confluence is processing notifications in the same thread as the one that triggered the action in the UI.
This might create an awful UI experience to the Confluence user, giving the impression the operation is not being executed.
The situation may worsen depending on user directory complexity, such as when nested groups are enabled and heavily used to configure space permissions and page restrictions.

The same occurs when adding or removing inline comments.

h3. Environment
This issue was validated on a vanilla Confluence Server on version *6.13.3*.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
h5. Creating a Page Comment
# Install a Confluence vanilla instance.
# Create 2,000 regular users in the internal directory that are part of _confluence-users_ group.
 #* The following shell script may help automating that task.
{code}
USRNAME=admin
USRPWD=admin
CONFBASEURL=http://localhost:26133/c6133

for i in $(seq 1 2000); do
 NEW_USRNAME=test_user$i
 NEW_USR_FULLNAME="Test User $i"
 NEW_USR_EMAIL="test_user"$i"@user.com"
 NEW_USR_PWD=test_user$i

 curl --user $USRNAME:$USRPWD -H "Content-Type: application/json" -H "Accept: application/json" -X POST -d "{ \"jsonrpc\" : \"2.0\", \"method\" : \"addUser\", \"params\" : [{\"name\" : \"$NEW_USRNAME\", \"fullname\" : \"$NEW_USR_FULLNAME\", \"email\" : \"$NEW_USR_EMAIL\"}, \"$NEW_USR_PWD\"], \"id\": 7 }" $CONFBASEURL/rpc/json-rpc/confluenceservice-v2?os_authType=basic >/dev/null 2>&1
done
{code}
# As the Confluence administrator, create a sample Blank Space -- let's call it _Test Space_.
# In _Test Space_ create a sample Blank Page -- let's call it _Page with 2000 watchers_.
# Add the 2,000 regular users as watchers of _Page with 2000 watchers_.
 #* The following shell script may help automating this task.
{code}
USRNAME=admin
USRPWD=admin
CONFBASEURL=http://localhost:26133/c6133
PAGEID=3540960

#######
# Change the following with actual values
# <ADD FULL COOKIE STRING>
# <ATL TOKEN>
#######
for i in $(seq 1 2000); do
WATCHER_USRNAME=test_user$i
curl $CONFBASEURL'/json/addwatch.action' -H 'Accept: application/json, text/javascript, */*; q=0.01' -H 'Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.5' -H 'Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=UTF-8' -H 'X-Requested-With: XMLHttpRequest' -H 'Connection: keep-alive' -H 'Cookie: <ADD FULL COOKIE STRING>' -H 'Pragma: no-cache' -H 'Cache-Control: no-cache' --data 'atl_token=<ATL TOKEN>&pageId='$PAGEID'&type=page&username='$WATCHER_USRNAME >/dev/null 2>&1
done
{code}
# Log in to Confluence UI as a regular user and access _Page with 2000 watchers_.
# Write a Page Comment and click on _Save_.

h5. Expected Results
The comment is created almost instantly and the UI is released to the user to continue its work on Confluence.

h5. Actual Results
After clicking on _Save_, the operation takes a long time, giving to the user a spinning wheel in the comment editor.
!create_comment_img001.png|thumbnail!
Eventually, the operation completes and the user perceives that by seeing the comment in the Page.
!create_comment_img002.png|thumbnail!

Checking the HAR file generated while reproducing this use case shows a {{POST}} request to {{<Confluence Base URL>/rest/tinymce/1/content/{{pageID}}/comment?actions=true}} takes too long.

If Page Profiling is enabled, then a similar entry to the following is logged in {{atlassian-confluence.log}}, but we don't have information on what is causing the long time to complete it:
{code}
2019-05-23 13:06:29,116 DEBUG [http-nio-26133-exec-10] [atlassian.util.profiling.UtilTimerStack] log [66087ms] - /c6133/rest/tinymce/1/content/4096007/comment
  [0ms] - UserAccessor.getExistingUserByKey()
  [0ms] - ContentEntityManager.getById()
  [1ms] - PermissionManager.hasCreatePermission()
    [0ms] - UserAccessor.isDeactivated()
      [0ms] - CrowdService.getUser()
        [0ms] - ApplicationDAO.findByName()
        [0ms] - UserDao.findByName()
    [0ms] - CrowdService.isUserMemberOfGroup()
      [0ms] - ApplicationDAO.findByName()
      [0ms] - MembershipDao.isUserDirectMember()
      [0ms] - MembershipDao.isUserDirectMember()
      [0ms] - MembershipDao.search()
    [0ms] - UserAccessor.isDeactivated()
    [0ms] - CrowdService.isUserMemberOfGroup()
      [0ms] - ApplicationDAO.findByName()
      [0ms] - MembershipDao.isUserDirectMember()
      [0ms] - MembershipDao.isUserDirectMember()
      [0ms] - MembershipDao.search()
    [0ms] - CrowdService.isUserMemberOfGroup()
      [0ms] - ApplicationDAO.findByName()
      [0ms] - MembershipDao.isUserDirectMember()
    [0ms] - DefaultSpacePermissionManager.hasPermissionNoExemptions(VIEWSPACE, regular_user001, TS1)
      [0ms] - CrowdService.isUserMemberOfGroup()
        [0ms] - ApplicationDAO.findByName()
        [0ms] - MembershipDao.isUserDirectMember()
    [0ms] - DefaultSpacePermissionManager.hasPermissionNoExemptions(COMMENT, regular_user001, TS1)

h5. Deleting a Page Comment
# Continue from the last step in the _Creating a Page Comment_ Section.
# Logged as a regular user, click on the _Delete_ button related to the recently added comment.
# Click on the _OK_ button in the pop-up with the confirmation question.

h5. Expected Results
The comment is deleted almost instantly and the user gets an obvious confirmation in the UI with the comment removed from the page.

h5. Actual Results
Clicking on the _Delete_ button triggers the delete action, but nothing changes in the UI so it gives the wrong impression to the user.
Refreshing the page shows the comment is still there what may trick the user on clicking the _Delete_ button again.

If a HAR file is generated while reproducing the problem, then a {{DELETE}} request to {{<Confluence Base URL>/rest/api/content/<comment ID>}} takes a long time to complete.
In the _backend_ side the delete operation is on-going, but it takes a long time to complete.

h3. Notes
The 2,000 watchers might be an exaggerated scenario, but it is used to show that something is wrong and is causing a bad UI experience to the Confluence user.
This issue is caused because Confluence is processing notifications within the same thread as the one executing UI operations.
Adding and deleting a comment to a page should be decoupled from the notifications tasks, meaning that any task related to notifications should be processed by a background thread.

Below is the result of a comparison on how long it takes to complete each action depending on the number of watchers in a page.
||{{#}} of watchers||Create comment||Delete comment||
|0|254ms|1,309ms|
|100|1,230ms|4,301ms|
|500|6,866ms|18,552ms|
|1,000|14,216ms|36,892ms|
|2,000|52,487ms|78,998ms|

h3. Workaround
[Tuning the cache|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/cache-performance-tuning-169119133.html] may help decreasing the time taken on each related operation, but won't remove the problem.
fields.summary: Creating or deleting page comments in pages with several watchers might be slow

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When an AD connector in Confluence incrementally syncs user directories it can remove users from their groups in Confluence. A full sync restores these users. 
h3. Environment

Tested in Confluence 6.x that has embedded Crowd 2.10, but all Confluence versions are affected
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an AD connector and set it to do incremental syncs with Active Directory
 # During an incremental sync, the embedded Crowd within Confluence will check for all of recently changed groups.

h3. Expected Results

Any user added to a group in AD that is set to sync with Confluence would be added to the corresponding group in Confluence.
h3. Actual Results

Any user in the group that was not modified is removed from Confluence and only the modified users are added. 

The below is an example INFO message of this from the atlassian-confluence.log file:
{noformat}
INFO [Caesium-1-3] [atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteChangeOperations] removeUserMembershipsForGroup removed [ 1462 ] user members from [ GROUPNAME ] in [ 10583ms ]
{noformat}
h3. Notes

During the incremental sync, for changed AD groups it will fetch their memberships. Unfortunately the embedded Crowd within Confluence will only ask for members who also were recently changed and then during the incremental sync, make them the only users existing in the local Confluence group. The embedded Crowd in Confluence will ignore all other users who were not a part in this synchronization as they were not changed, resulting in them being removed during the sync. 
h3. Workaround

Set the AD connector in Confluence to do FULL syncs only by un-checking the "Enable Incremental Synchronization" option in the Advanced section of the AD connector's settings.
fields.summary: Incremental user directory syncs from an AD connector removes users from Confluence groups

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Copying and then pasting an image from the already existing image on the page will result in a broken image in edit mode when using https.

h3. Environment
Confluence 6.15.4 running over HTTPS connection

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Upload an image to an empty page
 # Copy the image
 # Paste the same image to the same page

h3. Expected Results
The image will be displayed correctly.

h3. Actual Results
Image is not displayed at all, and in the DOM of the page, we can see that new image uses incorrect URL (src of the image) to the image as it uses HTTP instead of HTTPS.
 !Screen Shot 2019-05-23 at 12.40.13 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
The issue is not observable if the Confluence instance uses HTTP instead of HTTPS connection.
The issue is also visible with reverse proxy.

h3. Workaround
If instance uses a reverse proxy, make a rule to forward HTTP connection to https. That way the image will be resolved.
eg for Apache:
{code}
<VirtualHost *:80> 
Redirect permanent / https://www.yourdomain.com/ 
</VirtualHost>
{code}
fields.summary: Copying and then pasting image from already existing image on the page will result in broken image in edit mode.

fields.summary: Ability to view the original page where a page is copied from.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

User is unable to add an .mp4 video to an answer in Confluence Questions, when dragging and dropping the file into an answer, the Multimedia macro is created, however when trying to save the answer, the message "Errors found in contents of the answer." is shown.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence 6.15.2
 * Questions for Confluence 2.6.15

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new question and save it.
 # Add an answer and drag and drop any .mp4 file into the answer.
 # Notice that a Multimedia macro appears.
 # Try to save the answer.

h3. Expected Results

The answer would be saved with the multimedia macro.
h3. Actual Results

(!) The answer isn't saved and the message "Errors found in contents of the answer." shows up below the answer text box.
 !Screen Shot 2019-05-06 at 17.58.45.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround
 # On the menu bar for the answer's text box, click on the *Insert link* button.
 !Screen Shot 2019-05-06 at 18.10.32.png|thumbnail!
 # The *Insert link* window will be displayed, select the option *Files* on the left menu and upload the .mp4 file from there.
 !Screen Shot 2019-05-06 at 18.10.41.png|thumbnail!
 # Insert the file and save the answer. The video will be displayed in the answer as a link:
 !Screen Shot 2019-05-22 at 18.15.50.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Adding an mp4 video to an answer in Questions for Confluence returns Errors found in contents of the answer

fields.description:
h6. PROBLEM STATEMENT
Confluence allow users to set the search filter while searching the content however, users may need to repeat the filter everytime they search and new users who is not aware of the search filter will get a huge search result without filtering the search.

h6. SUGGESTION
It would be great if Confluence Administrator could add a custom search filter as a Search Preset to limit the search result when users search for a general keyword in Confluence Search.

h6. NOTES
Confluence user should be able to modify the following:
# Enable or disable the default search filter preset.
# a query text definition (to realize more complex presets – analog the advanced search)
#* Users should be able to disable the preset in their profile (enabled should be the default)
#* Users may be able to define their own preset (as an alternative to the admin default setting) in their profile.
fields.summary: Confluence Search Filter Preset

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After updating from Jira 7.13.1 to 8.0.2 the "Jira Issues Calendar" gadget stopped working on Confluence side.

Updated the Calendar plugin and the iCal plugin to 5.0.0 and 1.5.0 but the issue still remains.

The gadget does work in Jira but not in Confluence.
 In Jira, the *__MODULE_ID__* seems to get replaced by a number.
 This does not happen when the gadget is added to a Confluence page.
h3. Expected Results

The gadget should work as expected.
h3. Actual Results

In the JS console:
{noformat}
Uncaught ReferenceError: __MODULE_ID__ is not defined
at Object.ajaxOptions (ifr?container=atlassian&mid=1652235632640&country=GB&lang=en&view=default&view-params={"writable"%3A"false"}&st=atlassian%3AUesc%2Fa%2BQ2qVOxw8%2FywsU01ejCk5NZXu54mIp8sIol0d2YHE6pin5cFBgWEJAgqHRyGh7WyhZD7XFyodeZz8qSmDIBMXR5wpRKaDzl6vAaudt%2F%2F9hwXUztOTJCeEUmkD4lI6m7Wm3ygp7b4T6jsKUhOVwlDDvThGxZXSpLW9gAgOpoDi3vhvlojj1jApavEiZ05QzeBNS1XBYuKxfIXcNpmLrkusAI0hfr%2FbUrvB2NtmQWCdWMFlWQDoxbu0oqUZ7LJXz81YLuxIYszRQy8px17zBfE8U4PBH9TRfxxY%2FPi0eOEad9457szRvxD30n%2B16oGGMNgq31Zdv%2BWXEe0Z6NDWyc87EOgQ3jQL1jv5Qb%2Fpn9PH%2BTdMEwnfcFt1xj3%2BymOD%2FXw%3D%3D&up_isConfigured=true&up_projectOrFilterId=filter-20532&up_dateFieldName=customfield_11426&up_displayVersions=false&up_numOfIssueIcons=10000&up_refresh=15&url=https%3A%2F%2Fjira%2Frest%2Fgadgets%2F1.0%2Fg%2Fcom.atlassian.jira.ext.calendar%3Aissuescalendar-gadget%2Ftemplates%2Fplugins%2Fjira%2Fportlets%2Fcalendar%2Fgadget%2Fcalendar-gadget.xml&libs=auth-refresh:516)
at Object.ajaxOptions (com.atlassian.gadgets.publisher:ajs-gadgets-lite.js:33)
at Object.<anonymous> (com.atlassian.gadgets.publisher:ajs-gadgets-lite.js:6)
at Function.each (com.atlassian.plugins.jquery:jquery.js:17)
at c.fn.init.each (com.atlassian.plugins.jquery:jquery.js:17)
at Object.getDescriptorData (com.atlassian.gadgets.publisher:ajs-gadgets-lite.js:6)
at Object.build (com.atlassian.gadgets.publisher:ajs-gadgets-lite.js:6)
at Object.showView (com.atlassian.gadgets.publisher:ajs-gadgets-lite.js:33)
at com.atlassian.gadgets.publisher:ajs-gadgets-lite.js:36
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Note that this was only tested locally by the developer checking this error (no guarantees)

As a workaround I'd recommend to remove old gadgets jars and replace them with 4.3.7 version (I've tested it locally and it worked, but no guarantees here as it was quick and brutal test).
 * stop confluence
 * go to atlassian-confluence-6.15.7/confluence/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins
 * remove gadgets related jars
 atlassian-gadgets-api-4.3.2.1.jar
 atlassian-gadgets-directory-plugin-4.3.2.1.jar
 atlassian-gadgets-embedded-plugin-4.3.2.1.jar
 atlassian-gadgets-oauth-service-provider-plugin-4.3.2.1.jar
 atlassian-gadgets-opensocial-plugin-4.3.2.1.jar
 atlassian-gadgets-publisher-plugin-4.3.2.1.jar
 atlassian-gadgets-shared-4.3.2.1.jar
 atlassian-gadgets-spi-4.3.2.1.jar
 * copy updated jars
 atlassian-gadgets-api-4.3.7.jar
 atlassian-gadgets-directory-plugin-4.3.7.jar
 atlassian-gadgets-embedded-plugin-4.3.7.jar
 atlassian-gadgets-oauth-service-provider-plugin-4.3.7.jar
 atlassian-gadgets-opensocial-plugin-4.3.7.jar
 atlassian-gadgets-publisher-plugin-4.3.7.jar
 atlassian-gadgets-shared-4.3.7.jar
 atlassian-gadgets-spi-4.3.7.jar
 * start confluence, see if all the plugins are running and if calendar gadget is working correctly

Steps to reproduce:
 * Start Jira 8.3.1 (or later) and install Jira Issues Calendar latest version: [https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/293/jira-calendar-plugin?hosting=server&tab=support]
 * Restart Jira server
 * Create a project, add tickets and input "DUE DATE" for Jira ticket
 * Copy the Jira Issues Calendar gadget spec: XML file 
 * Start confluence 6.15.9 (latest 6.15.x)
 * Go to confluence admin -> external gadget: add url Jira Issues Calendar gadget spec above
 * Create application link Confluence < - > Jira
 * Create a page: In editor to insert gadget (search for Jira Issue Calendar), and Input Project Name into the filter
 * Saving the gadget config, then insert the gadget to the page
 * Go to view page and see result (open browser console)
 * Upgrade confluence to 7.0.1 to see the page again.
fields.summary: Jira Issues Calendar Gadget not working in Confluence

fields.description:
h4. Issue Summary

Neither the Office Connector PowerPoint macro or PDF macro display content correctly on a page when viewed as an anonymous user.
h4. Environment

Confluence 6.15.2
h4. Steps to Reproduce
 # Allow the 'can use' permission for anonymous users by way of  !https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/files/590259974/590058056/1/1398739558493/Cog.png! > *General Configuration* > *Global Permission*
 # Create a space and allow anonymous access in the Space Permissions.
 # Create a page in the Space and insert an instance of the Office Connector PowerPoint and/or PDF macro.
 # Access the page anonymously.

h4. Expected Results

A thumbnail image of the PowerPoint and PDF files should display on the page correctly.
h4. Actual Results

For the instance of the Office Connector macro, the attached file loads indefinitely when logged in anonymously.

For the instance of the PDF macro, the attached file displays a grey box when logged in anonymously.
h4. Work Around
 # Click on the "*...*" icon located in the upper right hand corner of the page.
 # Select *Attachments*
 # Open the attachments from the resulting screen.
fields.summary: Office PowerPoint and PDF macro do not display content when viewed as anonymous user

fields.description:
We are in aged care in Australia with 17 facilities.  Most of our staff are not full time. They work shifts.  In fact it takes around 3 staff to equal one full time equivalent.

We are using confluence and are planning it to be our corporate platform but we cannot justify the cost of moving from 2000 user tier to 10000 user tier knowing that the named user base may only be around 3000 which roughly equals around 1200 full time staff.

Can you please set up user tiers between the 2000 and 10000 that would enable businesses such as ours to enable confluence for all our staff.
fields.summary: Additional License Tiers

fields.description:
h3. Summary

As a Confluence User, I would like to be able to use Microsoft Stream within Confluence pages.
h3. Problem Statement

Currently, the Widget Connector macro does not support Microsoft Stream. For a user to connect with Microsoft Stream, HTML or iFrame macro must be used. This type of custom solution can be limiting for Cloud users
h3. Suggested Resolution

Add support for Microsoft Streams into the native macro in Confluence, Widget Connector. This should allow any user within the instance to use the solution.
h3. Workaround

Insert an iFrame to show the content of said video:
 [*iFrame Macro - Confluence Cloud*|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/iframe-macro-950276528.html]
 [*How to put an iFrame into Confluence - Confluence Server*|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-put-an-iframe-into-confluence-598837531.html]

Check this Microsoft Page on how to acquire the necessary information to share your videos:
 [*Embed Microsoft Stream videos*|https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/stream/portal-embed-video]

 

 

 
 _Previous Ticket Description_ 
 We use Microsoft Stream for internal videos. Currently, there doesn't appear to be an easy way to embed these videos in a Confluence page.
 Please consider adding support for Microsoft Stream to the Widget Connector macro to allow doing so.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Add support for Microsoft Stream to Widget Connector macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary

It's not possible to manually upload an app (Manage apps > Upload app) from a URL if the URL redirects to another which does not end in .jar.  It ignores the "Content-Disposition=attachment; filename=pluginhere.jar" header in the final response.

Users are not aware of the redirect (for example by github), so the user sees a failure with no obvious cause.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Browse to Manage Apps > Upload app > and paste link into From this URL.  An example link is: https://github.com/javamelody/jira-confluence-javamelody/releases/download/1.77.0/jira-confluence-javamelody-1.77.0.jar


h3. Expected Results

The header is not ignored, and the app is installed.


h3. Actual Results

The upload will fail and the following will be in the logs:
{noformat}deployPluginFromUnit Unable to deploy plugin 'null' from{noformat}


h3.Workaround

There is no workaround at this time.
fields.summary: It's not possible to manually upload an app using a URL, if it redirects to another URL which does not end by ".jar"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Confluence page with embedded JavaScript to render an SVG graphic of a .json file attached to that page is not showing the image on Chrome and Firefox browsers. It appears to be working fine in IE and Edge browsers. In Confluence version 6.10.2, all browsers are able to render the same without any issues
h3. Environment

Confluence 6.14.3
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a blank Confluence page
 # Ensure the site has the [Confluence Source Editor|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.editor.confluence-source-editor] plugin installed and you have permission to use the source editor.
 # Open the source editor and paste the storage format attached.
 # Apply and upload the changes

h3. Expected Results

If you open the page in IE you see the SVG image 

!SVG_IE_Edge.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

if you open it in FF or Chrome nothing is shown (see attached screenshots) and no errors in the logs.

!SVG_Firefox.png|thumbnail!

!SVG_Chrome.png|thumbnail!

 
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: D3.JS SVG rendering Browser Support

fields.description:
Maybe this is intended - otherwise it should be considered to be a bug.

From some UML tool we generate reports in Word format with the graphics included full size but reduced to fit the page view and print.

After Word import the images in Confluence are reduced in size which makes them pretty useless, as object names on the images are not readable anymore.

Behavior is the same regardless of Word format (doc, docx).

Is that an intended behavior and is there a workaround? I try to avoid to replace every imported image manually by its full size image.

Version is Confluence 6.1.0

fields.description:
h3. Summary

It would be great if there are additional custom filters for Confluence searches to let customers filter content or filters from apps in (i.e. filter by 'language' and 'version' ):

 !Snip20190520_7.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Background

From an app developer/vendor:
{quote}
We would like to add custom filters for Confluence searches to let customers filter content by for example version (Scroll Versions) or language (Scroll Translations).

We have been able to create filters that users can use with the 'advanced search' view (or when directly using cql). However we have not found a (supported) way to add extra filters to the new 'quick search' available starting from Confluence 6.15.

Similarly, with Scroll Versions it is possible to have multiple versions of the content of a Confluence space, and we would want to provide a possibility to limit the search to given version.

In the advanced search, apps can add custom integrations like 'language' or 'version' (see the attached screenshot), using https://developer.atlassian.com/server/confluence/adding-a-field-to-cql/

 !advancedSearchIntegration.png|thumbnail! 

But these filters are not available in the quick search - and more "advanced" filters probably should not be there to keep the UI easy to use. But 'language' and 'version' are important for users of the corresponding apps.

Additionally, in the new quick search experience, all the content types are visible by default. But we would actually prefer an option to choose that some of custom content types that our apps create are by default filtered out from the quick search results (while still being searchable when users want to) - this is because some of these custom content items can be confusing for a non-power user.
{quote}

h3. Impact

* _com.k15t.scroll.scroll-versions_ has *1,385* total app installations in the market
fields.summary: Add custom filter in the quick search

fields.description: Currently Confluence date format is set globally across all spaces and I have specific users wanting different formats.  I am suggesting that a possible profile setting be added that would allow all users to default the date format per their preference.
fields.summary: Provide User Profile Feature to Enable a Default Date & Time Setting

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition  

* In the Page History, there is a column called *Comment* which holds the comments made upon saving the editor (in the lower bar, next to the *Update* button). This column's name can be confusing to what comment is it referring to.

h3. Suggested Solution  

* Change the name of the *Comment* column to something more intuitive, which differs it from the comments made in the page itself.

h3. Why this is important   

* This avoids confusion to what is the content that should be displayed in the *Comment* column

h3. Workaround 
N/A
fields.summary: Change the name of the Comment column in the Page History

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition  

* There are a few useful templates that are currently available only in Confluence Cloud but could be used in Confluence Server and Data Center as well, for example, the Persona template.

h3. Suggested Solution  

* Make the Cloud templates available in Confluence Server and Data Center

h3. Why this is important   

* Some templates are very useful to the customer's business and it won't be necessary to create one from scratch based on an already existing template.

h3. Workaround 

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Make Confluence Cloud templates available in Confluence Server/Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
[HTTP/2|https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/performance/http2/] is designed to address several limitations found in HTTP/1.1.
Although Tomcat 9.X (and 8.5.X) supports HTTP/2, it can only be enabled with [Apache Portable Runtime (APR)|http://tomcat.apache.org/native-doc/], which is not natively compiled with bundled Tomcat in Confluence.

h3. Suggested Solution
Bundle Confluence with the necessary artifacts to enable HTTP/2 out-of-the-box and provide the necessary documentation to configure this.
Also, Confluence should be fully tested to work seamlessly with HTTP/2, as well as make use of some functionalities such as _push promise_ to improve application's performance.

{panel:title=Note|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5|titleBGColor=#3C78B5|bgColor=#E7F4FA}
There are additional Confluence architectural and design considerations that block this issue. Confluence requires under the hood changes to enable full asynchronous request support in addition to enabling the functionality in Tomcat. As such, even were APR connectors enabled with HTTP2 support, there would be little benefit compared to the provided workaround, and additional issues may arise.
{panel}

h3. Why this is important
Full benefits of HTTP/2 can only be achieved if it is enabled all the way through the network, although you can get most of it by terminating HTTP/2 on a web server.
Also, it would be important to have HTTP/2 working when there's no web server in front of Confluence.

h3. Workaround 
The supported workaround is to terminate SSL in a web server, such as NGINX and Apache, and configure it to accept HTTP2 connections.
fields.summary: As an administrator I would like to configure HTTP2 support in Confluence's Tomcat level

fields.description:
This request is to add or make available to download some blueprints from Confluence Cloud to Confluence Server.

When importing to Server, the missing blueprint will break pages and macros that use them, this suggestion would help with this.
fields.summary: Add or make available to download default Blueprints from Confluence Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, it is only possible to use Confluence macros within Confluence itself, but not within Confluence Questions

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the ability to embed macros into questions and answers in Confluence Questions.
fields.summary: Provide the ability to use macros within Confluence Questions

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Tasks should have IDs to avoid duplicating and also global referencing of those same tasks. 

h3. Why is this important
Referencing tasks in another page ends up creating new ones and using the Task Report macro does not allow for task editing.

h3. Suggested resolution
Generate sequential IDs for each task created
fields.summary: Create Global Tasks (Tasks with ID) in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary  

* Adding a Page Property macro inside another macro cause duplicated entries in the Page Property Report macro.

h2. Scenario 1 - Content is on the nested Page Properties macro

h4. Steps to Reproduce 
# Create one page with 3 Page Properties macros:
 !1.png|thumbnail! 
# Create another page with 3 Page Properties macros, but one of them is nested:
 !2.png|thumbnail! 
# On the third page, add a Page Properties Report macro, retrieving both these recently created pages and save it:
 !3.png|thumbnail! 

h4. Expected Results  

* The information of one page is shown only in one row of the Page Properties Report macro

h4. Actual Results 

* There are duplicated entries in the Page Properties Report macro when the page has nested Page Properties macros 

h4. Workaround

N/A

h2. Scenario 2 - Content is on the nested Page Properties macro

h4. Steps to Reproduce 
# Create one page with 2 Page Properties macros:
 !4.png|thumbnail!
# Create another page with 2 Page Properties macros, but one of them is nested:
 !5.png|thumbnail!
# On a third page, add a Page Properties Report macro, retrieving both these recently created pages and save it:
 !6.png|thumbnail!  

h4. Expected Results  

* The information on each page is shown once in the Page Properties Report macro.

h4. Actual Results 

* There are duplicated entries in the Page Property Report macro when the page has nested Page Properties macros. The duplicated entries don't show any content.

h4. Workaround

N/A

h2. Side Note

During the tests, it was not possible to reproduce the issue on Confluence 6.15.9.
fields.summary: Nested Page Property macros cause duplicated entries in the Page Property Report macro

fields.description:
Users complained that the search for spaces often shows several pages first before showing the space link.

Example: There's a space named ACC.4434. The search of "ACC.4434" doesn't list the space in the first 20 (at least) positions; expected would be 1st position. 
 !2019-06-26 14_17_05-Welcome Page - ACC.4434 - Access Confluence.png|thumbnail! 
 

Only when choosing type = "Space", it is listed first
 !2019-06-26 14_17_31-UI Confluence - Martin.Petry@1und1.de - Outlook.png|thumbnail! 
 

 

Because the space is the most prominent entity we would like to have the space at highest rank. Is it possible to take this into account for the future search algorithm?

Looking forward for your answer,

Martin
fields.summary: Search result order should consider Spaces with highest priority

fields.description:
This page on tables in Confluence 6.6 docs doesn't include anything about copying and pasting in tables from Excel: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf66/tables-943961723.html.|https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf66/tables-943961723.html]

Alternatively, some sort of KB article or separate doc/page on copying and pasting data from Excel into Confluence would be helpful.
fields.summary: Pasting Tips from Excel in Confluence Docs

fields.description:
Problem:

When integrating multiple Jira instances into one instance of Confluence, users are forced to register an external gadget from each instance. Thus, creating multiple gadgets using the same name. The end user is then forced to hover over each gadget to find the URL for the specific instance. This can be incredibly confusing when there are 5 or 6 Jira instances.

 

Request:

Register an external gadget/feed once and have a drop down on the edit screen that contains all the Jira instances integrated.
fields.summary: Simplify External Gadgets/Feed on a one to many integration

fields.description: In Confluence 6.6.13, pasting data into a top left cell resulted in everything being contained in that single cell - resulting in a lot of manual copy and paste work.
fields.summary: Keep cell format in a Confluence table when pasting data from Excel

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently it's not possible to [whitelist URLs|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/configuring-the-whitelist-381255821.html] using Rest API.  

Example use cases: As an admin, you can create an active list within a secured place, to see if users add, remove or change entries
in the whitelist. 

Opens up possibilities for vendors to implement whitelists for their add-ons.

h3. Suggested Solution/Workaround

Currently there is no solution or workaround at this time.
fields.summary: Allow Whitelisting using REST API

fields.description:
There is no good way to delete or edit attachments in a page or blogpost draft.

Our users sometimes have the problem that they have uploaded a wrong attachment and would like to exchange it before they publish the page or blogpost. In addition, the setting of labels for images in a picture gallery is problematic. Yo can´t set labels for the attachments while editing the page. This is necessary if the gallery should be restricted to one label.

So far, I found a user-unfriendly way how to do this anyway: temporarily add attachment macro, open the page preview, delete attachments, remove attachment macro.

It would be nice if there would be a standard function in the menu of the Confluence editor to delete or edit attachments while creating/editing the page or blogpost.
fields.summary: Delete or edit attachments in a page or blogpost draft
